description:
Refurbishment of the listed building including alterations
at roof level; alterations to the shopfronts; the formation
of an internal vehicular loading bay at the north end of the
Bloomsbury Square elevation; the erection of a roof over the
two existing two light wells to form atria, with new
internal walls, and the insertion of pods in the atria.  The
use of the building to involve:- retention of office use on
part of the ground and all the upper floors; double height
Class A1 retail units on the Southampton Row frontage;
retention of the existing bank on the southern corner and
introduction of new restaurant use (with entrance and bar on
Vernon Place); and a new health club on the basement floors.
as shown on drawing numbers and documents listed on the
schedule dated 18.1.2001, reissued on 6.4.2001
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Full details of the position, materials and detailed design
    of the shopfronts, in particular with respect to the
    junction with the pillars, shall be submitted to and
    approved by the local planning authority and installed prior
    to the reopening of the shop premises.

Condition : 2 - The Class A3 and Class D2 uses hereby permitted shall not be
    carried out outside the following times 07.00 hours to 24.00
    hours (midnight), Mondays to Saturdays and 07.00 hours to
    23.00 hours on Sundays.

Condition : 3 - Once the planning permission and listed building consent
    hereby approved has been implemented, the six shop units on
    the Southampton Row frontage, with the exception of the
    Class A2 unit on the corner of Vernon Place, shall not be
    used for any purpose other than a purpose falling within
    Class A1 of the Schedule of the Town and Country Planning
    (Use Classes) Order, 1987, or in any provision equivalent to
    that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-
    enacting that Order.

Condition : 4 - When implementing the consents hereby granted and submitting
    relating to the recommendations.
    details to discharge planning and listed building consents,
    full regard should be paid to the recommendations in the
    Buro Happold Access Audit, dated 4.12.2000, submitted with
    the planning application.  A report setting out the detailed
    implementation proposals in response to each of the
    recommendations in the submitted Access Audit shall be
    submitted to and approved by the local planning authority,
    prior to the implementation of any part of the project

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of any part of the development
    development involving plant and equipment in the proposed
    roof top plant rooms, noise levels at a point 1 metre
    external to sensitive facades are at least 5dB(A) less than
    the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in
    dB(A) when ALL plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is
    anticipated that any plant/equipment will have a noise that
    has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine,
    hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses
    (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should
    be given to reducing the noise levels from that piece of
    works relating to the installation of plant and equipment in
    plant/equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade to at least 10dB(A)
    below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).
    The scheme, once approved, shall be implemented and retained
    for the duration of the use, and be subject to the
    requirement to operate at all times in accordance with the
    above acoustic requirements.
    the roof top plant rooms, a full acoustic report (in
    accordance with the Council's recommended Acoustic report
    format) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council,
    as being in accordance with the Council's noise and
    vibrations criteria as set below: -
    Acoustic and other design measures should be included, in
    the details to be submitted, to ensure that for the new

Condition : 6 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust, or grit.

Condition : 7 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz
    inclusive, noise from all plant and machinery (measured in
    LAeq) shall at all times add not more than 1 decibel to the
    ambient noise level expressed as LA90 in the same octave
    band as measured 1 metre outside the window of any
    residential premises.

Condition : 8 - All plant and machinery shall be sound attenuated and
    isolated from the structure such that their use can be
    carried out without detriment to the amenity of adjoining or
    surrounding premises.

Condition : 9 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to
    be audible within any adjoining premises, or on the
    adjoining highway.

Condition : 10 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall be
    carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    building, or otherwise in accordance with the approved
    servicing and management plan.

Condition : 11 - The areas shown on the approved drawings as parking, access,
    loading and manoeuvring areas shall be provided and shall
    not be used other than for the purposes shown.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory in accordance with the requirements of
    policies EN1, EN13, EN20 and EN34 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - In order to secure implementation of the mix of land use
    proposals as submitted, to ensure that there is an
    appropriate mix of Class A1 and Class A3 use within the
    building in accordance with Unitary Development Plan
    policies SSH1 and SH1.

Condition : 15 - In order to ensure that the refurbishment accords with the
    recommendations of the approved access audit and complies
    with the aims of UDP policy RE3.

Condition : 16 - Fully detailed acoustic information has not yet been
    supplied to the Council setting out the type, quantity and
    acoustic characteristics of the plant proposed.  In
    accordance with UDP policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and RE2, the
    Council requires submission of clear evidence that the
    proposed plant is capable of operating within the noise
    threshold levels set out in the policies, prior to its
    installation, in order to protect the amenity of occupiers
    of surrounding buildings.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 21 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of nearby premises. in accordance with
    the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 22 - To ensure the availability of the facilities in accordance
    with the approved scheme in order to ensure compliance with
    the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 23 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council, which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 24 - It should be noted that the Council is unlikely to grant
    advert consent or listed building consent for projecting
    signage on the pillars, or the shopfronts.  Furthermore, the
    Council will resist listed building consent for illuminated
    signage on the signage Zone behind the glazing.

Condition : 25 - You are advised that condition no 2 means that no
    customers shall be on the premises and no activities
    associated with the Class A3 and Class D1 uses, including
    preparation and clearing up, shall be carried out otherwise
    than within the permitted time.

Condition : 26 - You are informed that under the planning permission hereby
    approved, the lawful use of the shop unit and ancillary
    space at basements 1 and 2, on the corner of Southampton
    Square and Vernon Place continues to be Class A2.  Under
    part 3, Class D of the GPDO 1995, a change of use of this
    unit to a use within Class A1 would be permitted
    development.

Condition : 27 - In good time, prior to the start of construction (or if
    appropriate, demolition) on site, the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Streets Management
    Traffic Management Section (tel: 020-7974 5629) detailed
    arrangements for the transportation of goods and materials
    to and from the site. The Council will prosecute those
    responsible for any breaches of the provisions of the
    Highways and Litter Acts that occur as a result of
    construction on the site.

Condition : 28 - The Council's Engineering Services should be consulted
    regarding the construction of the crossover on the public
    highway and any other work to, under or over the public
    highway, including pavement lights, vaults and thresholds.
    The Section dealing with these matters is located at Camden
    Town Hall, Argyle Street, London WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7974
    4444).

Condition : 29 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    (tel: 020-7278 4444).
    place other than between the hours of 08.00 to 18.00 on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00 hours to 13.00 hours on Saturday,
    with no working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to
    comply with locally enforced standards.  Such works shall at
    all times comply with the requirements and guidelines in the
    Council's Considerate Contractor Manual (Copy available from
    Council's Environment and Consumer Protection Service
    Pollution Team, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ,

Condition : 30 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environment and Consumer
    Protection Service Pollution Team, Camden Town Hall, Argyle
    Street, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444), or to seek prior
    approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty
    in carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises.

Condition : 31 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on each of the shop premises and the
    building in accordance with regulations made under Section
    12 of the London Building (Amendments) Act 1939.

Condition : 32 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all restaurants and bars to do so as
    well. Further information can be obtained by telephoning the
    Council's Street Environment Service (Recycling) on 020 7974
    1553.

Condition : 33 - Thames Water apparatus could be affected by the proposed
    development.  Therefore, prior to any work commencing, the
    Applicant must contact this company's Customer Field
    Services at Rose Kiln Court, Reading, (Tel 0645 200800) for
    advice regarding the exact location of any water mains in
    the vicinity.

Condition : 34 - Noise measurement shall be carried out jointly by the
    acoustic consultant and the Council's Technical Officer for
    the area, on completion of the project, to ensure that the
    associated noise levels near residential premises are
    actually within the Council's requirements.

Condition : 35 - The details required pursuant to additional condition(s) 1,
    4 and 5 should be submitted with the attached approval of
    details application form together with 5 sets of drawings
    and any other supporting information.
